conclusion: Determine the velocity of ions after the velocity selector and the charge-to-mass ratio of ions selected by the magnetic analyzer.
In the velocity selector, the electric field E is directed vertically upward, and the magnetic field B is directed outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
For ions to pass through the velocity selector without being deflected, electric force and magnetic force must be equal and opposite.
The electric force on the ion is F_E = qE.
The magnetic force on the ion is F_B = qvB.
For the ion to pass through the velocity selector undeviated, qE = qvB, leading to v = E/B.
The velocity v of the ions after passing through the velocity selector is v = E/B.
In the magnetic analyzer, ions move in a circular path due to the magnetic field B.
The radius R of the circular path is determined by the balance between centripetal force and magnetic force.
The magnetic force provides the centripetal force: qvB = mv^2/R.
The radius R is given by R = mv/qB.
Given that ions pass through the magnetic analyzer and exit at a specific radius, R must lie between R_1 and R_2.
Using v = E/B from the velocity selector, R = m(E/B)/(qB) = mE/qB^2.
Solving for the charge-to-mass ratio q/m gives q/m = E/RB^2.
Since R can be any value between R_1 and R_2, the charge-to-mass ratio q/m is q/m = E/RB^2 where R_1 <= R <= R_2.
The velocity v of the ions after passing through the velocity selector is v = E/B.
The charge-to-mass ratio q/m of the ions selected by the magnetic analyzer is q/m = E/RB^2 where R_1 <= R <= R_2.
